butools.ph.APH3rdMomentLowerBound

butools.ph.AcyclicPHFromME

butools.ph.APH3rdMomentUpperBound¶

butools.ph.APH3rdMomentUpperBound()¶
Matlab: m3 = APH3rdMomentUpperBound(m1, m2, n)
Mathematica: m3 = APH3rdMomentUpperBound[m1, m2, n]
Python/Numpy: m3 = APH3rdMomentUpperBound(m1, m2, n)

Returns the upper bound of the third moment of acyclic phase-type (APH) distributions of order n.

Parameters:

m1 : double

The first moment

m2 : double

The second moment

n : int

Number of states
Returns:

m3 : double

The highest third moment an order-n APH can have with the given first and second moment.

References

[R3]A. Bobbio, A. Horvath, M. Telek, “Matching three moments with minimal acyclic phase type distributions,” Stochastic models, pp. 303-326, 2005.

Examples

For Matlab:

>>> mean = 1.9;
>>> mom2 = 5;
>>> n = 3;
>>> APH3rdMomentLowerBound(mean,mom2,n)
   16.577
>>> APH3rdMomentUpperBound(mean,mom2,n)
   17.081

>>> mean = 1.9;
>>> mom2 = 5;
>>> n = 4;
>>> APH3rdMomentLowerBound(mean,mom2,n)
   16.079
>>> APH3rdMomentUpperBound(mean,mom2,n)
    Inf
